definitions.example: The meeting was suspended for lunch.

definitions.definition: To hold in an undetermined or undecided state.
definitions.example: to suspend one's judgement or one's disbelief

definitions.definition: To discontinue or interrupt a function, task, position, or event.
definitions.example: to suspend a thread of execution in a computer program
to suspend a ball by a thread

definitions.definition: To bring a solid substance, usually in powder form, into suspension in a liquid.
To debar, or cause to withdraw temporarily, from any privilege, from the execution of an office, from the enjoyment of income, etc.
definitions.example: to suspend a student from college; to suspend a member of a club

definitions.definition: To support in a liquid, as an insoluble powder, by stirring, to facilitate chemical action.
(travel) To remove the value of an unused coupon from an air ticket, typically so as to allow continuation of the next sectors' travel.
